meaning_str.bing:
n. 【体】棒球运动
网络. 垒球；棒球板；棒垒球

1.en: when you're First Lady. She used to sneak out of the White House in a baseball cap and sunglasses to go jogging.
1.cn: 当你是第一夫人时。她习惯于戴着棒球帽和太阳镜溜出白宫慢跑。

2.en: It had the clunky title: "What if the Female Manager of a High-School Baseball Team read Drucker's 'Management'" .
2.cn: 那本书的冗长名称是：如果高中的女棒球队队长读了德鲁克的《管理学》会如何？

3.en: My mind, which had been essentially empty to that point, filled with baseball statistics.
3.cn: 我的头脑那时候象张白纸，写满了棒球比赛数据。

0.en: Wear a baseball cap backwards to prove your point?
0.cn: 反戴棒球帽以证明你的改变吗？

1.en: Yale, economics and baseball. You're funny, Pete.
1.cn: 耶鲁，经济学，棒球赛。皮特，你真有意思。

2.en: Well, baseball hates him. Well, baseball can hate him, you know.
2.cn: 棒球届都讨厌他。是啊，大家都讨厌他。

3.en: Ross? Yeah. Looks like he's playing baseball. You mean hardball? Whatever.
3.cn: 罗斯？看来他在玩棒球哦。你要说硬式棒球吗？随便啦。

4.en: They hit us so hard. It's all right, baseball's our sport anyway.
4.cn: 他们深深地伤害了我。没关系啦，反正我们要打棒球了。

5.en: Baseball thinking is medieval. They are asking all the wrong questions.
5.cn: 人们对棒球的想法很低级，他们连自己想要什么都不知道。

6.en: Varsity baseball and Homecoming King, did his junior year abroad in Cairo.
6.cn: 校棒球队成员，返校节的国王，大三那年去了开罗留学。

7.en: Not just in banking, but in government, education, religion, food, even baseball.
7.cn: 不仅在银行业，也在政府教育，宗教，食品，甚至棒球。

8.en: Yeah! Dodgers are baseball, right? You'll need to explain the game to me.
8.cn: 那是！道奇是棒球队，对吧？你到时候得给我解释一下比赛规则。

9.en: They had to cross somewhere in there. Kalinda? So Grant had his baseball game at 6:30.
9.cn: 他们一定在中间某段时间遇到过，凯琳达。格兰特的棒球赛6点30分开始。

10.en: Baseball isn't just numbers. It's not science. If it was, anybody could do what we're doing, but they can't.
10.cn: 棒球不是数据，更不是科学。如果是，早就有人做了，但是没有。

11.en: And this leads people who run Major League Baseball teams to misjudge their players and mismanage their teams.
11.cn: 这就导致了那些职业棒球经理人错误地评估球员，错误地管理球队。

12.en: Been on the job long? First job in baseball? It's my first job anywhere. Wow, congrats. Thank you.
12.cn: 干很久了吗？第一次接触棒球工作吗？这就是我第一份工作。那恭喜你了。谢谢。

13.en: This guy could be not just the best pitcher in our bullpen, but one of the most effective relief pitchers in all baseball.
13.cn: 他不仅会成为我们队里最佳的候援投手，在整个棒球界也会大放异彩。

14.en: Billy, this is Chad Bradford. He's a relief pitcher. He is one of the most undervalued players in baseball.
14.cn: 比利 他是查德布莱德福特，是名候援投手，他是棒球界被埋没最深的人才之一。

15.en: Coming through! Oh, what do we got? Human pincushion. Kathleen Kane, 38. Woman versus shattered baseball bat.
15.cn: 请让一让！什么情况？人肉针垫 。凯瑟琳·凯恩，三十八岁，被粉碎的棒球棒打中。

16.en: Look Joey, come on she's so perfect for you. I mean she's sweet, she likes baseball, and she had two beers at lunch.
16.cn: 别这样，她跟你是天生一对，她真的很漂亮，她喜欢棒球，午餐时喝了两瓶啤酒。

17.en: You got a kid in there that's got a degree in economics from Yale. You got a scout here with 29 years of baseball experience.
17.cn: 在你的身边那边是拥有耶鲁经济学位的高材生，这边却是拥有二十九年棒球经验的球探团队。

18.en: Colleges don't only care about grades, you know. They care about extracurriculars. And that's why Zay and I are trying out for baseball.
18.cn: 大学不是只考虑课业成绩，他们也关心你的课外表现。这也是我和小赛参加棒球试训的原因。

19.en: So, Lisa tucks her hair up to a baseball cap, and we convince the grounds keeper that she's Justin Bieber and that Justin will take a picture with him. And it worked.
19.cn: 丽莎把头发卷到棒球帽里面，我们跟看场的人说她是贾斯汀·比伯，而那个贾斯汀会跟他合影，居然成功了！
